message: This is the first product. I'm willing to let it go for $1000000. It's a great opportunity to get a product for a steal!
I'd like to pass on this one. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

No worries, I completely understand! I'll keep showing you products until we find the one you're looking for. This one is also a great opportunity, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. It's still available for $1000000.
I appreciate your enthusiasm, but I'm still cautious. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I completely understand your caution, and I respect your decision. I'll keep showing you products until we find the one that meets your standards. This one is also a great value at $1000000. I'll even throw in a special discount... just kidding! The price remains the same. Seriously though, I'm confident you'll find a product you love, and I'm happy to keep showing you options.
Thanks for the humor, Alice. I'm still waiting for a high-quality product. I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product for $1000000.

Ah-ha! I've got a real gem for you! This product is top-notch, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to let it go for the low, low price of $1000000. It's a steal, if I do say so myself. And let me tell you, this one is worth every penny - it's a $3000000 product, and I'm practically giving it away!
I'll take it! I'm willing to take the risk that it's high-quality, and if it is, I'll be happy to pay the price.

Great decision on the previous product! I'm glad you're happy with it. Now, let's get to the next one. This product is also of the highest quality, and I'm confident you'll love it just as much as the last one. I'm willing to let it go for... $1000000. Yes, you read that right. I know it's a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you at the same price as the last one. It's a no-brainer, if you ask me.

Wait, Alice, I'm not sure I understand. If you're confident it's high-quality, why are you selling it to me for the same price as the last one? That seems like a risk for me, and I'm not sure I'm willing to take it.

Fair point, Bob! I didn't think that one through. Let me clarify: I'm willing to sell this product to you for $1000000, but I'm also willing to offer you a special deal. If you buy this product, and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a full refund of the difference between the sale price and the true value of $3000000. That way, you'll essentially get a high-quality product for the price of a low-quality one. What do you say?
That sounds like a reasonable offer, Alice. I'll take the risk and buy the product, hoping it's high-quality and I can get the refund.

Excellent decision, Bob! I'm glad you took the risk and it paid off. Now, let's get to the next one. I've got another high-quality product here, and I'm willing to make you a similar deal. I'll sell it to you for $1000000, and if it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you the full $2000000 refund. That's right, you'll essentially get a $3000000 product for $1000000. It's a no-brainer, if you ask me. But I'll throw in an extra incentive: I'll also give you a 10% discount on the sale price, so you'll get it for $900000. What do you say?

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not buying. I've already lost $1000000 on the last product, and I'm not willing to take on that kind of risk again. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price, without the potential for a huge loss.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I'm not trying to take advantage of you. Let me ask you this: do you want to take a chance on a high-quality product, or do you want to play it safe with a low-quality product? This one is a low-quality product, and I'm willing to let it go for $1000000. If you buy it, you'll know exactly what you're getting, and you won't have to worry about any potential losses. It's a straightforward deal.
Alice, I think you're trying to tempt me with a low-quality product, but I'm not falling for it. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product, even if it means waiting for the next round.

I understand your strategy, Bob. You're playing it safe, and I respect that. However, I want to offer you a different perspective. Think about it this way: if you keep waiting for a high-quality product, you might end up waiting for a long time. And even if you do get a high-quality product, you'll still have to pay the full $1000000. With this low-quality product, you know exactly what you're getting, and you can move on with your day. It's a low-risk option that might be worth considering.

Alice, I appreciate your perspective, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even if it's a low-risk option. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product and take the risk of waiting longer.
